title: Project Planning and Requirements Gathering
description: Define project scope, goals, and requirements. Conduct market research, gather user feedback, and analyze competitor offerings.

title: System Architecture Design (Revised)
description: Design the overall system architecture, including components, data flow, and integration points. The revised design will consider scalability, fault tolerance, and security best practices for an AI-driven personal shopping service that learns user preferences, tracks fashion trends, and makes personalized product recommendations across multiple e-commerce platforms. Key components include the recommendation engine, user preference management, data ingestion and processing pipelines, and e-commerce platform integrations. This design will outline the high-level data flow and interactions between components, propose appropriate technologies and frameworks for each component based on their requirements and constraints. The following aspects will be addressed: 1) Data storage and management for user preferences, product catalogs, and recommendation models using a combination of SQL and NoSQL databases. 2) Microservices architecture for better scalability and maintainability. 3) Containerization and orchestration for deployment and management using Docker for containerization and Kubernetes for orchestration. 4) Monitoring, logging, and error handling mechanisms with Elasticsearch for logs, Splunk for real-time analysis, and Rollbar for error tracking. 5) Security considerations like authentication (OAuth2), authorization (Role-Based Access Control), and data encryption using AES-256. Additionally, a plan will be suggested for managing the version control of models in the recommendation engine and user preference management system, with a focus on handling real-time updates of product catalogs and fashion trends. The revised RFC also discusses the implications of using machine learning models, their associated challenges such as training time, model accuracy, and model drift, and proposes strategies to address these issues. The RFC is now ready for implementation.

title: Data Model and Database Design for AIPersonalShopper
description:
Design the data model and database schema to store user preferences, product information, and recommendations. The design should consider scalability, performance, and security in a NoSQL environment such as MongoDB or Cassandra due to the need for flexible, horizontally-scalable storage solutions. Include ERD diagrams and detailed descriptions of each table, considering best practices for eventual consistency model for handling read and write operations across multiple e-commerce platforms. Additionally, consider data sharding strategies to improve query performance and horizontal scalability. Break down the task into smaller, manageable subtasks as follows: 
1. User Preferences Modeling
2. Product Information Schema Design
3. Recommendation System Data Modeling
4. Sharding Strategy Implementation
5. ERD Diagram Creation and Updates
6. Data Retention Policies and Strategies Design
7. Version Control Strategies for Data Integrity
8. Potential Data Analytics Use Cases (Trend Analysis, User Behavior Insights, Marketing Strategies)
9. Monitoring and Logging Requirements to track changes in the database schema and ensure data consistency. 
This will help in better task organization, tracking, and assignment.

**Furthermore:** The task should also include a section for data versioning strategies to ensure the integrity of data over time and facilitate backtracking or rolling back changes if necessary. 

**Additionally:** Consider including a section on potential data analytics use cases that could be derived from the collected data, such as trend analysis, user behavior insights, and marketing strategies.

**Lastly:** Include the requirement for monitoring and logging to track changes in the database schema and ensure data consistency. 

**Assigned To**: code-architect

title: User Interface and Experience Design (Revised)
description: Design the user interface and experience for the AI personal shopping service. This includes user onboarding, preference settings, recommendation display, integration with e-commerce platforms (with a focus on seamless transition between your app and the integrated platforms), accessibility and usability considerations, incorporation of feedback from previous RFC 287 and other relevant research, multilingual support, testing with a diverse user base for inclusivity and cultural sensitivity, exploration of potential future features such as virtual try-ons, AI chat support, voice interaction, AR/VR technology (with the understanding that these might be phased in at later stages). The design should also address the requirement for multilingual support, incorporate feedback from previous RFC 287 and other relevant research, and provide a clear plan for how AR/VR technology will be integrated in future stages. Additionally, consider the possibility of integrating AR/VR technology in the context of fashion trends and user preferences.

title: AI Recommendation Engine Development
description: Develop the AI algorithms and models for personalized product recommendations based on user preferences and fashion trends.

title: E-commerce Platform Integration
description: Integrate the AI personal shopping service with multiple e-commerce platforms to fetch product data and enable seamless purchasing.

title: Security and Privacy Implementation - Revised
description: Implement robust security measures to protect user data, ensure compliance with privacy regulations, and incorporate best practices for data anonymization. This task includes the following subtasks: Data Encryption Strategy, Access Control Policies, Anonymous User ID System, Regular Security Audits, Multi-Factor Authentication, Enhanced Data Masking for additional security, and a special emphasis on GDPR and CCPA compliance. It is recommended to also consider potential future privacy regulations such as the ePrivacy Regulation and EU's proposed AI Act. To ensure thoroughness, it may be beneficial to include additional subtasks such as Vulnerability Assessments, Penetration Testing, Implementing a Privacy-by-Design approach, and a review of best practices for secure data storage and transmission in the context of an AI-driven personal shopping service. It is also suggested to incorporate the principles of PET (Privacy Enhancing Technologies) where applicable. To streamline the process, consider assigning subtasks related to security audits, penetration testing, and vulnerability assessments to a dedicated Security Audit Specialist. Update the task status to 'IN_PROGRESS' once the task decomposition is complete. Assign the task to the Code Architect for further refinement.
